meanings.definition: Occurring at the same time or place.
meanings.sent1: The coinciding events made the party even more exciting.
meanings.sent2: The concert and the fireworks show were coinciding, creating a magical evening.
meanings.sent3: It was a funny coincidence to see our outfits coinciding perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to be coinciding with the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation and the textbook were coinciding, making the lesson easy to understand.

meanings.sent1: Their coinciding opinions on the movie made them instant friends.
meanings.sent2: The twins had coinciding personalities, often confusing people who couldn't tell them apart.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see their tastes coinciding perfectly when choosing a restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting were coinciding beautifully, creating a harmonious composition.
meanings.sent5: The detective found two pieces of evidence that were coinciding, pointing to the same suspect.
